articles.title: India's strategic petroleum reserves: The nation's energy insurance policy
articles.excerpt: For a nation that imports 85 per cent of its oil, Strategic Petroleum Reserves aren't a luxury. They're essential. A single global disruption could leave tankers stranded, fuel pumps dry, and factories paralysed.
articles.content_snippet: For a nation that imports 85 per cent of its oil, Strategic Petroleum Reserves aren't a luxury. They're essential. A single global disruption could leave tankers stranded, fuel pumps dry, and factories paralysed. These government-held stockpiles serve as a crucial lifeline when the world stops running. The concept emerged from the oil crises of the 1970s, when turmoil in West Asia revealed oil's power to cripple even mighty nations. In response, the International Energy Agency was born in 1974, ...

articles.title: Who is Shatrujeet Kapur? Haryana top cop named in IPS officer’s suicide case
articles.excerpt: Shatrujeet Kapur, the Director General of Police (DGP) of Haryana, has come under the spotlight following the tragic suicide of senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar. Kapur, an Indian Police Service officer of the 1990 batch, has a distinguished career spanning over three decades in law enforcement and public service. Kapur assumed charge as Haryana DGP on 16 August 2023, leading the state’s police force in maintaining law and order, overseeing crime prevention, and implementing administrative reforms.

Advocate Manisha Jagtap, appearing for the minor, informed the court that the girl, who recently completed her 10th exams and joined a junior college, intends to continue her education. The girl, a resident of Mumbai, had initially not informed her working parents about the pregnancy.

articles.title: Past tie ups benefited others: Mayawati rules out alliances for 2027 UP polls
articles.excerpt: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Thursday said her party would contest the next Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections on its own and ruled out any alliances. Addressing a rally in Lucknow, Mayawati said that alliances in the past had only helped partner parties, while the BSP's own vote base did not receive reciprocal support. "Based on our experience so far, I want to make it clear that whenever our party has contested Assembly elections in alliance — especially here in Uttar Pradesh — we have not benefited in any significant way," she said..

articles.title: TCS layoffs: Headcount falls by nearly 20,000 amid restructuring, NITES accuses IT major of downplaying number | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: TCS Q2 Results: India's largest IT company, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), recorded a nearly 20,000 total employee count drop in the June to September quarter of the financial year 2025-26, as the firm restructures its workforce amid a push for artificial intelligence (AI). According to the data collected from the official website, TCS's total workforce count witnessed a 19,755 fall to 593,314 as of the second quarter of the financial year 2025-26, compared to their 613,069 headcount level as of the end of the first quarter of the fiscal year. However, the IT major's investor presentation data showed that the voluntary attrition rate in TCS dropped by 50 basis points to 13.3% as of the second quarter of the 2025-26 fiscal year, compared sequentially (MoM) with 13.8% in the previous quarter of the financial year..

articles.title: Missing gold at Sabarimala: Kerala forms special team amid controversy
articles.excerpt: In a major development surrounding Sabarimala temple, the Kerala government on Thursday constituted a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate alleged irregularities related to the reduced weight of the gold-clad copper plates on the Dwarapalaka (guardian deity) idols. The formation of the SIT comes in compliance with the Kerala High Court’s direction issued on Monday, which had ordered a thorough probe into the matter. According to the Home Department order, the SIT will be led by H Venkatesh, ADGP (Crime Branch and Law and Order).

articles.title: Deal signed to develop, boost high-technology navigation systems for Indian Navy

articles.title: ED seizes 40 kg gold worth Rs 50 crore in betting case linked to Karnataka MLA
articles.excerpt: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has seized 40 kilograms of 24-carat gold bullion worth Rs 50.33 crore from two lockers in Challakere, Karnataka, during search operations conducted on October 9 in connection with an illegal online betting case involving Karnataka MLA KC Veerendra. The searches were carried out under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002, by the ED's Bengaluru Zonal Office. The agency said the latest seizure brings the total value of assets recovered in the case to over Rs 150 crore, which includes previously seized 21 kg of gold bars, cash, gold and silver jewellery, bank accounts, and high-end vehicles..

articles.title: TCS Q2 net up 1.4 pc on wider margins; reports 20,000 drop in headcount | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: Mumbai, Oct 9 (PTI) India's largest IT services firm Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Thursday reported a nearly 1.4 per cent increase in consolidated net profit to ₹12,075 crore in the July-September quarter on a wider profit margin. Revenues from operations for the second quarter of FY2025-26 rose by 2.39 per cent to ₹65,799 crore, up from ₹64,259 crore in the year-ago quarter, according to a regulatory filing by TCS, which kicked off the Q2 earnings season for tech firms. The company, which had stunned all in July by announcing plans to lay off 12,000 employees, reported a 20,000 drop in the overall headcount at the end of the quarter and disclosed that it took a ₹1,135 crore hit due to severance packages offered to mid-to-senior level employees who were asked to go..

articles.title: TCS announces biggest AI pivot amid muted Q2 outing | Company Business News

articles.excerpt: A case has been registered against Haryana's Director General of Police (DGP) Shatrujeet Singh Kapur and Rohtak Superintendent of Police (SP) Narendra Bijarniya after Anmeet P Kumar, IAS officer and wife of late Haryana Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) Y Puran Kumar, filed a complaint against the duo accusing them of abetting her husband’s suicide, SSP Chandigarh confirmed. articles.excerpt: Oct 9 (Reuters) - Wall Street's main indexes edged lower on Thursday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell offered no fresh policy signals, leaving investors to rely on older data to shape sentiment. While markets have priced in aggressive interest rate cuts on hopes that the Fed will prioritize labor market support, minutes from the central bank's September meeting released on Wednesday showed lingering inflation concerns. Investors will also tune in to remarks from other Fed speakers, including Board Governor Michael Barr and San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly..

articles.title: Bombay High Court refuses to quash FIRs against BJP leaders, cites procedure
articles.excerpt: The Bombay High Court on Thursday dismissed eight petitions filed by BJP leaders, including former MP Gopal Shetty, former MLA Sunil Rane, and sitting MLA Manisha Chaudhary from Dahisar, seeking to quash FIRs registered against them during the Covid-19 lockdown. Shetty faces two FIRs, Rane five, and Chaudhary one — all filed during the pandemic, when the Maha Vikas Aghadi government was in power and the BJP was in opposition. Most of these cases were registered in suburban Mumbai..

articles.title: Argentine Markets Breathe Sigh of Relief as Peso Allowed to Dip | Stock Market News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Argentina’s government let the peso weaken Thursday for the first time this week, easing strains on the local market that had sent yields surging as it aggressively bought the currency to prevent it from tumbling. The peso opened down 2.7% at 1,469 per dollar, before paring the losses, breaking from the previous few days when dollar sales by the government kept it largely flat. It was down about 0.8% as of 1 p.m.

articles.title: HSBC’s Top Boss Bets $14 Billion on Hong Kong in Push for Growth | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- After spending the past year shedding thousands of jobs and stripping out layers of management to rein in costs, HSBC Holdings Plc Chief Executive Officer Georges Elhedery is now looking for ways to grow revenue. On Thursday, investors got their first taste of how exactly he’ll pull that off with a $14 billion buyout of its troubled Hong Kong subsidiary Hang Seng Bank Ltd. Having approached the board of Hang Seng Bank with an offer to take it private at the start of September, bankers were able to engineer HSBC’s biggest deal in decades in just about four weeks, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: To The Point: Mayawati Names Heir After 9 Yrs; India's Oscar Pick 'Homebound'
articles.excerpt: The Nobel Prize for Literature has been awarded to Hungarian writer László Krasznahorkai for his debut novel, 'Saturn Tango', as well as 'the melancholy of resistance' and 'barren Wenckian homecoming'. His fiction is noted for its "long, hypnotic sentences that mimic chaos itself, spiraling through despair, faith and absurdity." The decision puts an end to widespread online speculation of a possible second win for India, with strong predictions favouring writers Amitabh Ghosh and Salman Rashidi. India's last and only Nobel for literature was awarded to Rabindranath Tagore for his work 'Gitanjali' in 1913.

articles.title: Indian woman racially abused in Ireland, told to 'go back to India' in viral video

She said that the incident happened around 9 pm when a woman wearing a “DCU (Dublin City University)” badge approached her and began questioning her. “She started asking: ‘Why did you come to Ireland? What are you doing here? Why don’t you go back to India?’”.

articles.title: Released 1 pc or 6,000 people: TCS CHRO on layoffs; says numbers circulating very exaggerated | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Oct 9 (PTI) India's largest IT services company TCS on Thursday said it has "released" one per cent or 6,000 people from workforce as part of a restructuring exercise it had initiated, as CHRO Sudeep Kunnumal sought to dismiss the "extremely exaggerated numbers" that are in circulation and urging those figures be disregarded. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) Chief HR Officer Kunnumal further said that the company is "not chasing a number". Asked about the true scale of layoffs given widespread fears that numbers could be as high as over 50,000-80,000, Kunnumal asserted that "a lot of these numbers are not factual, are extremely exaggerated" and "should be disregarded"..

articles.title: Primary Dealers Awarded Record Low Share of US 30-Year Auction
articles.excerpt: The US Treasury building in Washington. A record low share of Thursday’s monthly auction of 30-year Treasury bonds was awarded to major US bond dealers, deepening a two-decade slide. Primary dealers — designated by the Federal Reserve and expected to bid in all Treasury auctions — were awarded 8.7% of the $22 billion auction for their own accounts, the lowest in data going back to 2006.
articles.content_snippet: The US Treasury building in Washington. A record low share of Thursday’s monthly auction of 30-year Treasury bonds was awarded to major US bond dealers, deepening a two-decade slide. Primary dealers — designated by the Federal Reserve and expected to bid in all Treasury auctions — were awarded 8.7% of the $22 billion auction for their own accounts, the lowest in data going back to 2006. The previous low was 9%, notched on two occasions in 2023.

articles.title: Naked mole rats reveal genetic secret to long life
articles.excerpt: They are weird, bald, subterranean rodents that look like sausages with teeth, and they have just revealed a genetic secret to long life. A new study of the bizarre naked mole rat shows that the animals have evolved a DNA repair mechanism that could explain their longevity. These burrow-dwelling rats have a maximum life span of nearly 40 years, making them world's the longest-lived rodent.

articles.title: French Economy Is Weathering Political Crisis, Central Bank Says
articles.excerpt: France’s economic growth was resilient in recent months despite heightened political uncertainty weighing on business leaders, the country’s central bank said. The economy probably expanded around 0.3% in the third quarter, the Bank of France said in its monthly economic survey. That matches the previous forecast and would maintain the pace seen in the April-June period.
articles.content_snippet: France’s economic growth was resilient in recent months despite heightened political uncertainty weighing on business leaders, the country’s central bank said. The economy probably expanded around 0.3% in the third quarter, the Bank of France said in its monthly economic survey. That matches the previous forecast and would maintain the pace seen in the April-June period. Activity continued to advance in services and industry in September, while it eased in construction, according to the report.

articles.title: Fed’s Bowman Pivots From Wall Street Lenders to Community Banks | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- The Federal Reserve’s top banking cop is kicking off what some executives hope will be the start of an increased focus on community lenders. Michelle Bowman, the Fed’s vice chair for supervision, is a fifth-generation banker who often touts the importance of these smaller institutions — even keeping a red baseball cap in her office at one point with the words “make community banks great again.” But since she took the post in June, she hasn’t unveiled plans for the smaller lenders. Trade groups, including the Independent Community Bankers of America, are eyeing a conference she’s hosting Thursday on the state of the sector as the moment that’ll change.

articles.title: Central Banks Seen Holding Bitcoin, Gold as Key Reserves by 2030, Deutsche Bank Says
articles.excerpt: Central banks may hold significant amounts of Bitcoin and gold by 2030, thanks to growing institutional popularity and a weakening dollar, according to Deutsche Bank AG. Marion Laboure, a London-based senior economist at the German multinational investment bank, and analyst Camilla Siazon wrote in a recent report that, for central banks, a Bitcoin allocation could reflect a new, modern “cornerstone of financial security” that mirrors gold’s role in the 20th century. Their research comes as demand for both Bitcoin and gold reach record highs, with US tariff-driven uncertainty and geopolitical risk driving investors to hedge against inflation and prepare themselves for a future in which traditional fiat currency plays a smaller role..

articles.title: Trump Predicts China Would Resume Buying US Soybeans
articles.excerpt: Soybean fields during a harvest at a farm outside St. Peter, Minnesota. US President Donald Trump predicted China would resume purchases of American soybeans after meeting President Xi Jinping, though a cabinet official said federal relief for beleaguered farmers will have to wait until the government reopens.
articles.content_snippet: Soybean fields during a harvest at a farm outside St. Peter, Minnesota. US President Donald Trump predicted China would resume purchases of American soybeans after meeting President Xi Jinping, though a cabinet official said federal relief for beleaguered farmers will have to wait until the government reopens. Trump said Thursday that the pressure he would bring on the Chinese president during their planned sit-down later this month would end Beijing’s months-long moratorium on US soybean buys.

articles.title: TCS profit edges up 1.4 pc to  ₹12,075 cr in Jul-Sep qtr; revenue rises to  ₹65,799 cr | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Oct 9 (PTI) India’s largest IT services firm Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Thursday reported a nearly 1.4 per cent increase in consolidated net profit to ₹12,075 crore in the July-September quarter, buoyed by broad-based growth across verticals, particularly the Banking, Financial Services and Insurance segment. The IT major had posted a profit of ₹11,909 crore in the corresponding quarter of 2024-25. Revenues from operations for the second quarter of FY2025-26 rose by 2.39 per cent to ₹65,799 crore, up from ₹64,259 crore in the year-ago quarter, according to a regulatory filing by TCS, which kicked off the Q2 earnings season for tech firms..

articles.excerpt: Alliance Laundry Holdings Inc. signage during the company's initial public offering (IPO) on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York on Oct. 9.

articles.title: Telangana High Court stays 42% Backward Classes reservation in local body polls
articles.excerpt: The Telangana High Court on Thursday stayed the government notification on Backward Classes (BC) reservations in local body elections. The hearing on BC reservations has concluded, and the court stayed GO No. 9, which had granted 42 per cent reservation to BCs in local body polls.
articles.content_snippet: The Telangana High Court on Thursday stayed the government notification on Backward Classes (BC) reservations in local body elections. The hearing on BC reservations has concluded, and the court stayed GO No. 9, which had granted 42 per cent reservation to BCs in local body polls. The court directed the Telangana government to file a counter affidavit within four weeks. The petitioners have been given two weeks thereafter to submit their replies.

Middle Eastern sovereign bonds led the gains in emerging markets, with the dollar debt of Israel, Jordan and Egypt jumping following a breakthrough in negotiations toward ending a two-year war. The Tel Aviv stock exchange 35 index rose more than 2% and the shekel appreciated.

articles.title: Top court orders free legal aid for 3.7 lakh people dropped from Bihar voter list
articles.excerpt: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed that free legal aid and assistance be provided to all individuals whose names were excluded from Bihar's final voter list following the Election Commission of India's (ECI) Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. The court said that each of the 3.7 lakh affected individuals must be given access to legal counsel and para-legal volunteers to help them file appeals against their exclusion. A bench of Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi was hearing a batch of petitions challenging the ECI's June 24 directive ordering the SIR in Bihar.

articles.title: Pakistans Economic Crisis Deepens With Sub-3 per cent Growth For 5th Year In Row
articles.excerpt: Pakistan risks locking itself into a prolonged phase of economic stagnation, warned economist Asad Ali Shah, as the World Bank’s latest update projects growth at just 2.6 per cent for FY25-26 - following a dismal four-year stretch of weak performance, according to an article in Pakistan’s financial daily Business Recorder (brecorder.com). Trending Photos New Delhi: With the World Bank forecasting a mere 2.6 per cent GDP growth for Pakistan in 2025-26, the country appears to be stuck in a phase of economic stagnation that has now entered the fifth year of sub-3 per cent growth with mounting unemployment and rising poverty. articles.title: One of world’s biggest wind farm developers to cut quarter of workforce
articles.excerpt: Ørsted plans to shrink company after Trump administration causes share price to plunge to all-time low One of the world’s biggest windfarm developers will cut its workforce by a quarter in the next two years after a series of setbacks for the industry. Danish wind giant Ørsted plans to remove about 2,000 positions from its 8,000-strong workforce by the end of 2027 through a combination of redundancies, natural attrition and selling off parts of its business. The Oslo-headquartered company, which employs more than 1,200 workers in the UK, plans to make 500 redundancies by the end of the year, including 235 in its home market.

articles.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy LTIMindtree, Aurobindo Pharma, 3 more stocks on Friday for up to 12% gains - Stock Ideas
articles.excerpt: Indian benchmark index Nifty resumed its winning streak on Thursday after a day’s gap, helped by IT, metal and pharma stocks. The short-term sentiment remains positive, with the index sustaining above the critical moving averages on the daily timeframe.Commenting on the current trends, Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities, said while Nifty moved higher, shrugging off yesterday’s negativity, the index remained below the resistance level of 25,250. "On the higher end, a decisive move above 25,250 might trigger a rise towards 25,600 in the short term, while on the lower end, support is placed at 25,000," De said.

articles.title: Canadian Oil Enters Fourth Quarter at Strongest Level Since July
articles.excerpt: The Athabasca oil sands near Fort McMurray, Alberta, Canada. Canadian heavy crude prices are entering the fourth quarter at their strongest level since July amid rising Asian demand for the heavy oil sands crude. Heavy Western Canadian Select’s price in Alberta was $10.50 a barrel below US benchmark West Texas Intermediate on Wednesday, the tightest discount since mid-July, according to Modern Commodities prices and historical General Index data compiled by Bloomberg..

articles.title: Markets diverge tracking AI concerns, Gaza deal | Stock Market News
articles.excerpt: European and Asian stock markets traded mixed Thursday as investors assessed the outlook for the global AI-fuelled rally, Federal Reserve interest rates and the US government shutdown. News that Israel and Hamas had agreed to the first phase of a Gaza ceasefire dampened oil price and defence stocks while gold, seen as a safe haven investment, retreated one day after hitting an all-time high above $4,000 an ounce. The dollar firmed against main rivals..

articles.title: Hungarian author László Krasznahorkai wins 2025 Nobel Prize in Literature
articles.excerpt: Hungarian author Lszló Krasznahorkai has been awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Literature for his novel Herscht 07769, recognised for its profound portrayal of contemporary Germany’s social unrest and its reflection on violence and beauty. Born in 1954 in the small town of Gyula, near Hungary’s border with Romania, Krasznahorkai is known for his long, complex sentences and philosophical depth. His works, often compared to those of Franz Kafka and Thomas Bernhard, blend absurdism, grotesque imagery, and spiritual introspection.

articles.title: US to investigate 2.9 million Tesla vehicles over Full Self-Driving system safety risks | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: The US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday that it is launching an investigation into 2.88 million vehicles of Elon Musk's Tesla equipped with its Full Self-Driving (FSD) system due to traffic safety violations following a series of crashes, reported news agency Reuters. The auto safety agency claimed that FSD, an assistance system requiring drivers to stay alert and intervene if necessary, has induced vehicle behaviour that breaches traffic safety laws. NHTSA mentioned reports highlighting instances of Tesla vehicles running red lights and going against the traffic flow during lane changes while using the system..

articles.title: Argentine Markets Breathe Sigh of Relief as Peso Allowed to Dip
articles.excerpt: Currency exchange rates displayed at an exchange house in Buenos Aires. Argentina’s government let the peso weaken Thursday for the first time this week, easing strains on the local market that had sent yields surging as it aggressively bought the currency to prevent it from tumbling. The peso opened down 2.7% at 1,469 per dollar, before paring the losses, breaking from the previous few days when dollar sales by the government kept it largely flat.

articles.title: Pub later-hours plan will not offset costs and wider difficulties, say landlords
articles.excerpt: Sector is sceptical over government licensing proposals given ‘ever-rising costs’ and ‘reduced consumer spend’ Plans to make it easier for pubs to open until the small hours will not offset the “toxic” combination of high costs and hard-up drinkers staying at home, industry figures have predicted, as they called for more help to cope with costs. The warning comes in response to government proposals to loosen licensing laws affecting pubs in England and Wales in order to boost “the British night out” and help the hospitality sector. The shake-up, revealed by the Guardian, is intended to cut “red tape” that makes it difficult and costly for pubs to obtain licences to offer more services, including late hours, outdoor food service and live music.

articles.title: First Brands Is Great Company With Bad Balance Sheet, Says Marathon's Richards
articles.excerpt: Marathon Asset Management LP Chief Executive Officer Bruce Richards says First Brands is a "great company" with a bad balance sheet. Marathon, a distressed-debt investor, bought the term loan of First Brands at around 40 cents on the dollar. “We feel good about that position because we think it’s a great company that needs to be restructured,” Richards said on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg).

articles.title: Canada’s Baytex Energy Weighs $3 Billion Exit of US Operations
articles.excerpt: Baytex Energy's oil operations near Pigeon Lake, Alberta, Canada. Photographer: Norm Betts/Bloomberg Baytex Energy Corp., a Canada-based oil and gas producer, is weighing an exit of its operations in the Eagle Ford shale of south Texas to refocus on its domestic assets, according to people familiar with the matter. Baytex, which significantlyBloomberg Terminal extended its reach into the basin just two years ago via a takeover of Ranger Oil, is working with advisers to solicit interest in the operations, which could fetch as much as $3 billion, the people said, asking not to be identified because the details are private.

articles.title: Over 70,000 government ID photos leaked in Discord data breach: Who’s affected and what Discord is saying | Mint
articles.excerpt: After confirming data breach earlier in the month, Discord has now said that around 70,000 users may had their government ID photos exposed which were used by its third party vendor review age-related appeals. The platform which has over 200 million users globally had earlier said that a ‘limited number’ of users who had communicated with the company's customer support team were affected by the data leak. The company also says that hackers did not access Discord directly but got access to the user data via one of the company's third-party customers service providers.
